column2: The number of advisor pairings experienced by the participant

Block structure of the first subblock in a block. Structure values list numbers of
0.	Catch trials
1.	Force trials
2.	Choice trials
The duration of the change advisor screen during which the participant can request an alternate advisor by pressing a button.
The number of choice trials in each block of the main experiment.
Participant’s response to being asked for final questions or comments on the experiment. This may be redacted if required for preserving participant data security

List detailing the staircasing information
•	start: starting stepsize
•	end: minimum stepsize
•	nReversals: number of reversals before decrementing stepsize
•	current: tracker for current stepsize
•	currentReversals: tracker for reversals
The starting number of dots in each box before the dotDifference is applied
Whether the participant was excluded from further data analysis. Contains either FALSE (not excluded) or a reason for exclusion
Duration of the experiment (ms)
Whether or not the participant receives feedback at specific stages of the experiment
Time feedback screen is visible for trials with feedback (ms)
Block structure of the second subblock in a block

The identification code for the participant. Where the participant comes from Prolific this is the sha1 hash of their Prolific ID. Where they do not, this is the sha1 hash of their starting timestamp plus a random decimal portion.
This corresponds to participantId in other data frames
Participant’s response to the question of what the difference between the advisors was. This may be redacted if required for preserving participant data security
A shorthand integer used for identifying a particular participant
Number of practice blocks
Number of trials in the practice block. This is in addition to the training trials
Number of catch (no advisor) trials in the practice blocks
Number of choice trials in the practice blocks
Number of forced (no choice of advisor) trials in the practice blocks
Time between fixation appearance and stimulus onset (ms)
The time between blank screen and fixation cross appearance (ms)
Time stimulus is visible (ms)
Timestamp of the end of the experiment
Timestamp of the start of the experiment
